page.title: 09MEAT PROCESSING,HARTFORD
page.content: The plant employs no preserving technique except for freezing and packing. After the meat has matured it is placed in the blast freezer. It costs Â£6 per hour to run the 2 machines which cost Â£80 000 each. The meat turns very hard and grey in colour. After the meat has passed through some more processing procedures, it is packed into bags and taken to the cold store where the temperature can reach -40 degrees Celsius. Orange lights have been installed to make the workers feel warmer because they often have to stay inside for half an hour. The owner had to plant trees round the plant to avoid possible complaints from local residents. At present there are 54 workers. Expansion is planned but this involves moving to Winsford.
